unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra - The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state, aiming for complete coverage by 2025. This initiative is part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS) and seeks to reduce Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses.
normalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra - The M S E D C L is accelerating the deployment of smart meters across the state, aiming for complete coverage by two thousand and twenty five. This initiative is part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme and seeks to reduce Aggregate Technical and Commercial losses.

unnormalised: The initial phase focuses on urban areas, with Pune and Nagpur already seeing significant installations. As of 14/07/2024, over 5 lakh smart meters have been installed. MSEDCL officials reported at a press conference held at 11:00 hrs yesterday that the project is proceeding according to schedule.
normalised: The initial phase focuses on urban areas, with Pune and Nagpur already seeing significant installations. As of fourteenth july two thousand and twenty four, over five lakh smart meters have been installed. M S E D C L officials reported at a press conference held at eleven zero zero hours yesterday that the project is proceeding according to schedule.

unnormalised: Consumers can expect benefits such as accurate billing, remote meter reading, and real-time energy consumption monitoring through a dedicated mobile app. This enhanced transparency is expected to empower consumers to manage their electricity usage more effectively. The estimated investment for the entire project is Rs. 34,000 crore. Phase 2, starting 01/01/2025, will extend the rollout to rural areas, addressing challenges of connectivity and infrastructure. The initiative is inspired by the Centre's push for a 'Digital India' and aims to improve grid efficiency and reliability across Maharashtra.
normalised: Consumers can expect benefits such as accurate billing, remote meter reading, and real-time energy consumption monitoring through a dedicated mobile app. This enhanced transparency is expected to empower consumers to manage their electricity usage more effectively. The estimated investment for the entire project is rupee thirty four thousand crore. Phase two, starting first january two thousand and twenty five, will extend the rollout to rural areas, addressing challenges of connectivity and infrastructure. The initiative is inspired by the Centre's push for a 'Digital India' and aims to improve grid efficiency and reliability across Maharashtra.
